competencies.name: Driver checks that the vehicle’s audible reversing alarm is working at full volume
Driver checks that the reversing lights are in full working order
Driver checks that all mirrors are clean, properly adjusted and not cracked or broken
If the vehicle is over 3.5 tonnes the driver checks that any reversing camera system is in full working order
competencies.supportingText:
1. How do you operate the camera reversing system in vehicles over 3.5 tonnes?
  2. What safety checks do you carry out on camera reversing systems in vehicles over 3.5 tonnes?

competencies.name: Driver reports any defects immediately to supervisor and awaits further instructions
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the procedure for notifying your supervisor of any defects on the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver assesses the area to be reversed into and identifies any pedestrian movements and obstructions
Driver contacts supervisor where pedestrians or parked vehicles prevent access
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the procedure for notifying your supervisor when pedestrian movement or obstructions prevent reversing?

competencies.name: Driver avoids confrontation with members of the public when planning for reversing operations
competencies.supportingText: 1. What are your company’s suggested methods of avoiding conflict with the public when assessing if it is safe to reverse?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that, if necessary, trained reversing assistants are available and that they do not enter the crush zone and that their safety will not be at risk when reversing
Driver ensures all other crew members are in the cab or outside the crush zone
Driver completes the full reversing procedure before any loading begins
Driver reverses slowly and with constant vigilance using the rear view camera and mirrors
Driver keeps the reversing assistant in clear view at all times.  Driver stops immediately if sight is lost to re-establish the position of the assistant before continuing with reversing
Driver obeys the site rules on reversing procedures when collecting or tipping off at third party or own company premises
competencies.supportingText:
1. What are the major safety rules that must be complied with when reversing during collection or tipping operations on third party premises?
  2. What are your company’s safety rules on reversing?

competencies.name: Driver uses the creep and peep method of reversing when operating a one-man operated vehicle making sure that they are aware of their surroundings
competencies.supportingText:
